STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 27, 2021
Jennifer Woods
42nd Circuit Court - Family Division
3712 E Ashman Street
Midland, MI 48642
RE: License #: CA560234172
42nd Circuit Court - Family Division
3712 E Ashman Street
Midland, MI 48642
Dear Ms. Woods:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/22/2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation
Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of
any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
2.) This agency does not serve plaintiff class youth; therefore, MISEP requirements
do not apply.
3.) This agency does not serve plaintiff class youth; therefore, there is no contract and
policy requirements do not apply.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
None needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the renewal evaluation completed
07/29/2020. The only area identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation
was R 400.12324 (8).
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license/approval.
09/23/2021
